author: kort3x
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

trying to create session to second linux box (both Ubuntu 14.04):
$session = New-PSSession -HostName manubuntu -UserName admerlin
## Expected behavior

+PS /home/admerlin> $session = New-PSSession -HostName manubuntu -UserName admerlin
 +The authenticity of host 'manubuntu (192.168.114.249)' cannot be established.
 +ECDSA key fingerprint is SHA256:2kCbnhT2dUE6WCGgVJ8Hyfu1z2wE4lifaJXLO7QJy0Y.
 +Are you sure you want to continue connecting (yes/no)?
 +admerlin@manubuntu password:
## Actual behavior

PS /home/admerlin> $session  = New-PSSession -HostName manubuntu -UserName admerlin
New-PSSession : [manubuntu] The background process reported an error with the following
message: "The named pipe target process has ended.".
At line:1 char:6
- $s = New-PSSession -HostName manubuntu -UserName admerlin
-      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
  - CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Manageme....RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace)
    [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
  - FullyQualifiedErrorId : 2100,PSSessionOpenFailed
## Environment data

PS /home/admerlin> $PSVersionTable

Name                                       Value
PSVersion                                   6.0.0-alpha
PSEdition                                   Core
PSCompatibleVersions              {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                              3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                             v6.0.0-alpha.9
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion                3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion    2.3
SerializationVersion                  1.1.0.1

```
```

comments.author: DexterPOSH
comments.body:
Able to repro the error when connecting from Ubuntu 14.04 (machine 1) to a CentOS (machine 2), using the New-PSSession -HostName <> -UserName <>

Machine 1

```
PS /vagrant_data> lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
Release:        14.04
Codename:       trusty

```

Machine 2

``` Shell
[vagrant@dev ~]$ rpm --query centos-release
centos-release-6-6.el6.centos.12.2.x86_64
```

Environment 

```
PS /vagrant_data> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
PSEdition                      Core
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.9
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: kirby14
comments.body:
I get the same exact error trying to connect from OS X to Windows (works from Win to Win)

```
Name                           Value                                           
----                           -----                                           
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                     
PSEdition                      Core                                            
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                         
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                         
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.9                                  
CLRVersion                                                                     
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                             
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                             
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Per the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md#remoting-support), this is **not yet supported**.  Please follow the progress on the [PSRP on Linux repo](https://github.com/PowerShell/psl-omi-provider). Closing as duplicate of #942.

title: new-pssession fails to connect to second linux box
